Facilities Management
Mission Statement
Facilities Management is responsible for providing a clean, safe, and comfortable work environment for all county and public facilities owned by the county. This includes performing all maintenance of the facilities and adjusting accommodations to meet the needs of the occupants. This department also constructs new facilities as needed or oversees the contracted resources used for new construction.
Contact Information
Travis Williams – Facilities Manager
travis.williams@hardeecountyfl.gov
Jamie Roelle – Facilities Coordinator
jamie.roelle@hardeecountyfl.gov
Florentino Parada – Facilities Supervisor
florentino.parada@hardeecountyfl.gov
Hardee County Public Works
205 Hanchey Rd
Wauchula, FL 33873
Office Phone
(863 ) 773-3419
Fax
(863 ) 773-0107
Hours of Operation
Mon-Fri: 7 AM to 4 PM

Mission Statement
Facilities Management is responsible for providing a clean, safe, and comfortable work environment for all county and public facilities owned by the county. This includes performing all maintenance of the facilities and adjusting accommodations to meet the needs of the occupants. This department also constructs new facilities as needed or oversees the contracted resources used for new construction.

Emergency Management
Mission Statement
The mission of Hardee County Emergency Management is to provide a comprehensive and integrated emergency management system that coordinates community resources to protect lives, property, and the environment through mitigation, preparedness, response, and recovery from all natural and
man-made
hazards that may impact our county.
Pages
FAQ’s
Mitigation
Preparedness
Recovery
Plans
Quick Resources
Hardee County keeps citizens safe and informed with Everbridge Resident Alerts. Residents and businesses can sign up to receive critical Communications and Emergency Alerts
Alert Hardee County
Disaster Supply Checklist for Hurricane Preparedness
Pet Friendly Shelter Forms - English
Pet Friendly Shelter Forms - Spanish
Special Needs Application - English Version
Special Needs Application - Spanish Version
WeatherSTEM
Hardee County Emergency Management, in partnership with the Florida Severe Weather Mesonet, is providing local real-time weather data at two locations within Hardee County
.  These units are solar-powered, cellular WeatherSTEM units rated to withstand the most intense weather and winds up to 185 miles per hour.  To view the live feeds, visit
hardee.weatherstem.com
.

Emergency Management
Mission Statement
The mission of Hardee County Emergency Management is to provide a comprehensive and integrated emergency management system that coordinates community resources to protect lives, property, and the environment through mitigation, preparedness, response, and recovery from all natural and
man-made
hazards that may impact our county.
Pages
FAQ’s
Mitigation
Preparedness
Recovery
Plans
Quick Resources
Hardee County keeps citizens safe and informed with Everbridge Resident Alerts. Residents and businesses can sign up to receive critical Communications and Emergency Alerts
Alert Hardee County
Disaster Supply Checklist for Hurricane Preparedness
Pet Friendly Shelter Forms - English
Pet Friendly Shelter Forms - Spanish
Special Needs Application - English Version
Special Needs Application - Spanish Version
WeatherSTEM
Hardee County Emergency Management, in partnership with the Florida Severe Weather Mesonet, is providing local real-time weather data at two locations within Hardee County
.  These units are solar-powered, cellular WeatherSTEM units rated to withstand the most intense weather and winds up to 185 miles per hour.  To view the live feeds, visit
hardee.weatherstem.com
.

Office of Management & Budget
Mission Statement
The mission of the Office of Management and Budget is to properly manage the County’s budget in accordance with state regulations and to ensure that the budget process and results demonstrate high accountability, integrity, and prudent expenditure of public funds.

For persons with disabilities, please contact Holly Smith for alternate versions.

Grants Management
Housing Assistance Applications
Contractor Application
Housing Rehabilitation Application
First Time Home Buyer
Mission Statement
Grants Management’s mission is to provide an integrated system of resources, services, and opportunities to help people improve their lives, the lives of others, neighborhoods, and the total community.
Work is performed under the Assistant County Manager – Finance.
Departmental Services
Grants Management offers continuous dedication to our community through coordinating, monitoring, and maintaining a centralized database of all grants and grant projects for the County. Grants Management also assists the Departments and Grant Consultants in the acquisition, implementation, and administration of grant programs. Housing assistance programs are offered to the citizens of Hardee County.
Eligibility requirements apply to the programs offered.
Housing Rehabilitation Program
Housing Rehabilitation is provided to low-income range Hardee County owner-occupied, single-family residents (excludes mobile homes ) to make repairs/alterations that improve the health, safety, and well-being of occupants of the
home
, address structural integrity and preservation of the
home
, modify the
home
for accessibility for elderly or physically impaired occupants, and address weatherization or to correct code violations.
First Time Home Buyer Program
Purchase assistance,
to aid with closing costs and down payment, is provided to First Time Home Buyers whose household income is in the low to moderate income range.
Fair Housing
Federal Law prohibits discrimination
on the basis of
race,
color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or familial status when renting, selling, or financing a home or property.
Fair Housing Information

Departmental Services
Grants Management offers continuous dedication to our community through coordinating, monitoring, and maintaining a centralized database of all grants and grant projects for the County. Grants Management also assists the Departments and Grant Consultants in the acquisition, implementation, and administration of grant programs. Housing assistance programs are offered to the citizens of Hardee County.
Eligibility requirements apply to the programs offered.
Housing Rehabilitation Program
Housing Rehabilitation is provided to low-income range Hardee County owner-occupied, single-family residents (excludes mobile homes ) to make repairs/alterations that improve the health, safety, and well-being of occupants of the
home
, address structural integrity and preservation of the
home
, modify the
home
for accessibility for elderly or physically impaired occupants, and address weatherization or to correct code violations.
First Time Home Buyer Program
Purchase assistance,
to aid with closing costs and down payment, is provided to First Time Home Buyers whose household income is in the low to moderate income range.
Fair Housing
Federal Law prohibits discrimination
on the basis of
race,
color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or familial status when renting, selling, or financing a home or property.
